repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: :fclose closes extui windows before user floats.

Solution: Add immutable _ui field to FloatConfig. Windows with
_ui="_extui" are skipped by :fclose.

Fix #36123 

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body:
This hack is not acceptable. What other approaches are there? cc @luukvbaal Why can't we set `hide=true` and/or `focusable=false` on the Pager/etc windows?

~~Somewhat related, I also think that the Pager/etc windows should never be entered by `<c-w>w` and similar window-navigation things.~~ Fixed: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/36139
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -58,6 +58,7 @@ function M.check_targets()
         api.nvim_win_close(M.wins[type], true)
       end
       M.wins[type] = api.nvim_open_win(M.bufs[type], false, cfg)
+      api.nvim_win_set_var(M.wins[type], '_extui_window', true)

comment_data.body: It is not acceptable to start sprinkling special cases in random parts of the window code.

`hide/focusable` are set accordingly. Problem here is that besides hidden message windows, the cmdline is a non-hidden float, which is closed first by `:fclose`.

> What other approaches are there?

To support this properly in the API we could reconsider adding a `WinConfig->ui` flag, rather than basing/guessing some of these decisions on the `hidden/focusable` flags as we have done until now.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -58,6 +58,7 @@ function M.check_targets()
         api.nvim_win_close(M.wins[type], true)
       end
       M.wins[type] = api.nvim_open_win(M.bufs[type], false, cfg)
+      api.nvim_win_set_var(M.wins[type], '_extui_window', true)

comment_data.body:
> reconsider adding a `WinConfig->ui` flag

That sounds better indeed. Though I haven't seen a case where cmdline would be closed by `:fclose`. If it's not focused then it should have `focusable=false`. I could be missing something?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -58,6 +58,7 @@ function M.check_targets()
         api.nvim_win_close(M.wins[type], true)
       end
       M.wins[type] = api.nvim_open_win(M.bufs[type], false, cfg)
+      api.nvim_win_set_var(M.wins[type], '_extui_window', true)

comment_data.body: Yes `unfocusable=false` is set, but that doesn't seem a valid reason for `:fclose` to skip over it (and isn't in this PR, hence the new variable as an identifier). User would likely expect a visible float to close, even if it is unfocusable.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -58,6 +58,7 @@ function M.check_targets()
         api.nvim_win_close(M.wins[type], true)
       end
       M.wins[type] = api.nvim_open_win(M.bufs[type], false, cfg)
+      api.nvim_win_set_var(M.wins[type], '_extui_window', true)

comment_data.body: I’ve considered adding a field to WinConfig, but that would expose it through the API, allowing anyone to modify it, which could cause fclose to malfunction. We need a non-exposed unique identifier for internal use as the check.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -58,6 +58,7 @@ function M.check_targets()
         api.nvim_win_close(M.wins[type], true)
       end
       M.wins[type] = api.nvim_open_win(M.bufs[type], false, cfg)
+      api.nvim_win_set_var(M.wins[type], '_extui_window', true)

comment_data.body:
A UI flag wouldn't make much sense to be toggleable. So that could be resolved by only allowing it to be set with nvim_open_win, not nvim_win_set_config.

The point is that checking for random variables in the C core is undesirable.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -58,6 +58,7 @@ function M.check_targets()
         api.nvim_win_close(M.wins[type], true)
       end
       M.wins[type] = api.nvim_open_win(M.bufs[type], false, cfg)
+      api.nvim_win_set_var(M.wins[type], '_extui_window', true)

comment_data.body:
I had in mind a boolean value, simply indicating that it is a window belonging to a UI (we should try to avoid special casing extui in the C core). But it seems that is not specific enough for what we're trying to solve here. `:fclose` should probably be expected to close the extui `msg` window popup, since it is indiscernible from a regular float.

Maybe what is wanted here is a more specific `pinned/persistent` flag, which marks a window to not be closed by e.g. `:fclose`, or `:only`, but only when specifically targeted. I think extui would only mark the cmdline window as such, not the msg/pager/dialog windows. Seems better than a magic UI flag whose connotations are hidden away in the C core, rather than a documentable flag.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3899,6 +3899,8 @@ nvim_open_win({buffer}, {enter}, {config})                   *nvim_open_win()*
                   • _cmdline_offset: (EXPERIMENTAL) When provided, anchor the
                     |cmdline-completion| popupmenu to this window, with an
                     offset in screen cell width.
+                  • _ui: (EXPERIMENTAL) Mark floating window ui type. Value

comment_data.body: @luukvbaal thanks for adding this case. I use (nmapped) `:fclose` to close visible extui windows (excluding cmdline) and it would be good to keep this behavior (it does not work here now) and forgot about checking it through the progress of changes.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3899,6 +3899,8 @@ nvim_open_win({buffer}, {enter}, {config})                   *nvim_open_win()*
                   • _cmdline_offset: (EXPERIMENTAL) When provided, anchor the
                     |cmdline-completion| popupmenu to this window, with an
                     offset in screen cell width.
+                  • _ui: (EXPERIMENTAL) Mark floating window ui type. Value

comment_data.body: emm there need a special check for `:only` 🤔  or I only need add `fclose` support for `pinned` in this PR ?

The behavior described in the docstring looks good to me. Are you saying that this code does not yet work for `:only`?
If there is consensus that this is an appropriate flag (@justinmk @bfredl), full command coverage can come in a followup (by me if you like). Thanks for working on this @glepnir!

comment_regular_data.body:
Sorry for the confusion: I forgotten that I left appended `zindex = 202` to my winconfig in the local repro. Unfortunately the original repro still doesn't work for me. 

For comparison, the test case given here works for me.
~~how about now?~~ wait for a while ..
I guess it was the window containing cmdline buffer. After excluding focusable windows my repro works as expected. Not sure if it's good in general.

It fails:
```lua
local api = vim.api
api.nvim_open_win(api.nvim_create_buf(false, true), false, {
  relative = 'editor',
  width = 10,
  height = 3,
  row = 1,
  col = 1,
  zindex = 200,
  hide = true,
})
api.nvim_open_win(api.nvim_create_buf(false, true), false, {
  relative = 'editor',
  width = 20,
  height = 2,
  row = 5,
  col = 5,
  zindex = 50, -- Lower zindex than hidden window
  focusable = false,
})
```

problem is that we need to skip floating windows from extui, but there’s no identifier for them. Maybe we need to check the filetype or add some kind of flag.  It might work now, but the filetype isn’t a reliable identifier — it can be set arbitrarily and cause unintended skipping.
Still fails on my recent example.
should work now.  used a buffer variable as the identifier (not sure if others memeber will be satisfied with this approach) and update test case
Hm, without inspecting I see that both my repros fails now.
test case is passed ? it's your repro.
I see, but for some reason it does not work when used in real env. Have you checked both manually? edit: probably my fault, give me a while.
I tried it works fine on my local . i can close this window when enable extui

The fault on my side was quick testing `./build/bin/nvim` (instead installed copy or without fixing rtp) so the recent _extui lua changes left unused. After using it the repro included as the test case here works for me. 

The second repro (https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36130#issuecomment-3393206325) still fails on the installed instance.

> The second repro (https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36130#issuecomment-3393206325) still fails on the installed instance.

I have update for it  in 7 minute ago 🤔
Now I get correctly closed windows in both cases :tada:
Now it works for me also for extui :rocket: The only missing piece seems to be a test case for pinned windows.
Maybe the title and description are also worth mentioning about the new parameter if approved.
description and test cases will be updated once the design stabilizes. Since the current approach is still uncertain, I haven’t updated them yet.

title: fix(float): skip hidden and extui windows in :fclose
